channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why Restoring Power After Helene Is Complicated
item.description: Damage went beyond downed power lines. Hundreds of substations went out after the storm. Getting them back online is difficult.

item.title: Here’s the real reason 75% of corporate AI initiatives fail
item.description: 'Adding AI to a business model of the past doesn’t lead to competitiveness—it simply solidifies old processes,' writes the author of The Humanchine.

item.title: Port Strike Begins on East and Gulf Coasts
item.description: Members of the International Longshoremen’s Association walked out for the first time since 1977 in a standoff over wages, benefits and job security.

item.title: US job openings rose in August, surprising economists
item.description: The Labor Department reported Tuesday that employers posted 8 million vacancies in August, up from 7.7 million in July.

item.title: MacArthur Foundation Announces 2024 ‘Genius’ Grant Winners
item.description: On Tuesday, 22 anonymously nominated Americans were recognized with fellowships and an $800,000 stipend.

item.title: 3 Children Injured, One Seriously, in Zurich Stabbing Attack
item.description: The police in Switzerland’s largest city said they had arrested a 23-year-old man after a midday stabbing attack.

item.title: Discover’s CIO says AI in financial services is still in the ‘early stages’ as the industry navigates 2 risks
item.description: Gen AI will eventually be a “very robust enabler” in financial services, says Jason Strle of Discover Financial Services.

item.title: U.S. economy is on the cusp of another Roaring ’20s, says UBS
item.description: "By early 2025 only the most pessimistic investors will need rose-colored glasses to see a clear path to a Roaring ’20s outcome," a UBS analyst says.

item.title: What to Watch For in Tuesday’s Vance-Walz Debate
item.description: As the two running mates hold their first debate in New York, here is what to be on the lookout for.

item.title: Live Updates: Iran Launches Missiles at Israel, Israeli Military Says
item.description: The attack came after Israeli forces carried out a ground invasion of southern Lebanon targeting the Iranian-backed militia Hezbollah.

item.title: Gen Z is breaking into the trade sector as college disillusionment rises
item.description: The youngest working generation looks to blue-collar jobs while prioritizing stability.

item.title: Is That a Panda at the Zoo? Or a Dog in a Disguise?
item.description: Zoos around the world have occasionally used a little dye, or just brazenness, to pass off one animal as another.

item.title: We May Be Moments From a Ballistic Missile War in the Mideast
item.description: And this one could involve the United States.

item.title: Map: Israel’s Ground Invasion of Southern Lebanon
item.description: While details of the operation are scarce, Israel has ordered residents of many southern towns to move north.

item.title: U.S. Raises New Concerns Over Chinese Lending Practices
item.description: A Treasury official will call for greater transparency over emergency currency “swap” loans to struggling countries by China’s central bank.
